programme.title: Hey Duggee S4 Ep7

programme.desc: Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters uncover the news and unique stories about what's really going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt.

programme.title: If You're Listening - The Inflation Nation Ep3
programme.desc: Inflation in Argentina is at 100%. The government is printing money and locals spend in US dollars because the peso is so unreliable. Once a wealthy country like Australia, Argentina has totally lost control of its economy.

programme.title: Ticket To The Cup Ep9
programme.desc: The Matildas are through to the final four at the Women's World Cup after Australia beat France in an epic penalty shootout. The Matildas next face European champions England, while Spain face Sweden in the other Semi Final.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season - Round 23 - Richmond v North Melbourne Ep132
programme.desc: A 36 point loss to St Kilda all but ends Richmond's hopes of playing finals. Under interim coach Andrew McQualter the Tigers sit 13th with 9 wins and a draw. They face 17th placed North Melbourne coached by Alastair Clarkson.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season - Round 23 - GWS Giants v Essendon Ep133
programme.desc: Sudden death football comes two weeks early as GWS host Essendon. The Giants slid to 10th after a 51 point loss to Port, while the Bombers sit in 9th after a close win over the Kangaroos. Both sides must win to play finals.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season - Round 23 - St Kilda v Geelong Ep134
programme.desc: Geelong's 8 point loss to Collingwood saw the Premiers slide to 11th. With only 10 wins, the Cats must win their last two matches to having any finals hopes. They face St Kilda, after the Saints beat the Tigers to sit in 6th.

programme.title: Australia Remastered: Wild Australians - Platypus and Echidna Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Echidnas and platypuses are unique, the only mammals in the world to share some traits with reptiles, such as laying eggs. Aaron Pedersen explains how they are highly-tuned to their environment. (Final)

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent - Inside Iran: The Fight Continues Ep16
programme.desc: Almost a year since widespread protests over women's rights erupted on the streets of Iran, young Iranians who are still defying the country's repressive regime, talk about the price they are prepared to pay for freedom.

programme.title: Four Corners - Breaking the Cycle Ep29
programme.desc: The children of Australia's meth crisis. Thousands of Australian babies are born exposed to their mothers' drug use every year. We investigate what's being done to tackle one of the hidden side effects of the drug epidemic.

programme.title: Media Watch Ep28
programme.desc: Marvelous Matildas; X kills Twitter; Kyle's indecency obsession; No ordinary renter.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep66
programme.desc: The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Biz Stream Special Edition
programme.desc: This episode looks at how some companies are taking traditional Japanese paper into the future through even more sustainable production methods and creative new applications.

programme.title: National Parks Of Japan:Daisen-Oki
programme.desc: Daisen-Oki National Park comprises the Oki Islands, which boast spectacular geological formations, and a mainland area with shrines and sacred mountains that gave rise to myths and legends.

programme.title: Lunch On!
programme.desc: We go to a craft beer brewery in Niigata that was established to revitalize the local economy. On days when they are super busy, the owner brings lunch she's cooked for herself and her only employee.

programme.title: Dining With The Chef Mini
programme.desc: Learn about Japanese home cooking with Master Chef Saito, based on traditional Japanese cooking techniques in five minutes! Featured recipe: Lamb Niku-jaga.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: A Culture Built With Wood Kiso
programme.desc: The Kiso region in Nagano Prefecture is covered by coniferous forests that have been tended by human hands over generations. Join us as we savor the rich culture they've shaped.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Former street kid John DeYoung, who developed easy-to-handle water purification filters, now delivers "water for life" to Ukraine as well as to developing countries. He explains his mission.

programme.title: Core Kyoto
programme.desc: The Seven Lucky Gods, who have varied origins and are often depicted on a boat, have sparked a boom in shrine visits. A pilgrimage of seven temples and shrines dedicated to each originated in Kyoto.

programme.desc: A gourmet tour of ramen all around Japan. This time: the birthplace of tonkotsu, Fukuoka. Looking at three different styles, we'll learn this ramen's secrets, and the story of its creation.

programme.title: Design X Stories

programme.desc: The Kiso region in Nagano Prefecture is covered by coniferous forests that have been tended by human hands over generations. Join us as we savor the rich culture they've shaped.

programme.title: Core Kyoto
programme.desc: The Seven Lucky Gods, who have varied origins and are often depicted on a boat, have sparked a boom in shrine visits. A pilgrimage of seven temples and shrines dedicated to each originated in Kyoto.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: My Street Piano
programme.desc: Surrounded by cute figurines, a piano stands inside a station located in central Hokkaido Prefecture. Watch players from all walks of life come to share their melodies on the piano.

programme.title: Design X Stories
programme.desc: Today's theme: Design Hunting in Amami Oshima. A rich natural landscape inspired a unique culture and traditions. Island music, glazes, dyes, and designs feature forests, ocean, animals, and plants.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: A unique time-lapse photography project. Shot by pros and non-pros from around the world, on the transience of nature, celestial phenomena, cityscapes and each single moment of everyday life.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life: The Star Festival
programme.desc: For the annual Tanabata Star Festival, families across Edo flew bamboo stalks adorned with strips of paper and ornaments representing wishes. We examine what their wishes tell us about their lives.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Japan
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a variety of short programs focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: Japan From Above: Up Close
programme.desc: This program takes you on an aerial journey across 21st century Japan. Enjoy the bird's-eye view of unique landscapes as well as intimate portraits of the people who inhabit the archipelago.

programme.title: Lunch On!
programme.desc: We go to a craft beer brewery in Niigata that was established to revitalize the local economy. On days when they are super busy, the owner brings lunch she's cooked for herself and her only employee.

programme.title: Japanology Plus Mini
programme.desc: Japanology Plus explores Japanese life and culture. In this 5-minute digest, we look at plastic food samples: accurate replicas of real dishes.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Biz Stream Special Edition
programme.desc: This episode features companies that have developed unique robot technology to not only improve efficiency but to increase safety at construction sites.

programme.title: National Parks Of Japan:Daisen-Oki
programme.desc: Daisen-Oki National Park comprises the Oki Islands, which boast spectacular geological formations, and a mainland area with shrines and sacred mountains that gave rise to myths and legends.

programme.title: Asia Insight
programme.desc: Dynamic Asia. Stories behind the world's largest continent as it faces political, economic, cultural and technological change.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: A Culture Built With Wood Hida
programme.desc: The Hida region in Gifu Prefecture has some of Japan's most extensive broadleaf forests and has been home to artisans who possess sophisticated woodworking skills, such as kigumi or wood joinery.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Horiuchi Yoshimi is running a library in a small city in Northern Thailand. She is blind, yet she has the passions about reading and believes it can change lives for the better future.

programme.title: Bento Expo
programme.desc: Maki and Marc prepare bentos with abura-age: deep-fried tofu. Marc makes a Kinchaku Tamago Bento while Maki makes a Pork Inari Bento. From Bali, a picnic featuring ikan bakar, a tasty seafood dish.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Kawahara Takuya upcycles discarded jeans. His partner, Yamasawa Ryoji buys old denim overseas by the ton. Together these denim devotees make it cooler than cool once again.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Biz Stream Special Edition

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: A unique time-lapse photography project. Shot by pros and non-pros from around the world, on the transience of nature, celestial phenomena, cityscapes and each single moment of everyday life.

programme.title: Special Program
programme.desc: A wide range of topics featuring Japanese culture and society are introduced.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Artists Against War
programme.desc: Nakata Ryo, leader of funk band Osaka Monaurail, talks about the potential of protest songs and the role of musicians in relation to the war.

programme.title: Ramen Japan 5Min.
programme.desc: A gourmet tour of ramen all around Japan. This time: the birthplace of tonkotsu, Fukuoka. Looking at three different styles, we'll learn this ramen's secrets, and the story of its creation.

programme.title: Japan Railway Journal
programme.desc: Railway companies have begun taking steps to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in Japan to net-zero by 2050. See the next generation of hybrid trains and the efforts made to create a greener railway.

programme.title: Biz Stream Special Edition

programme.title: National Parks Of Japan:Akan-Mashu
programme.desc: Akan-Mashu National Park is home to Lake Akan, Lake Kussharo, and Lake Mashu. It provides unique winter sights and the opportunity to experience the indigenous Ainu culture.

programme.title: The News

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Sandhagen vs Font
programme.desc: Prelims - A bantamweight bout between former interim UFC Bantamweight Championship challenger Cory Sandhagen and Umar Nurmagomedov was expected to headline the event. However, Nurmagomedov withdrew from the event in mid-July due to a shoulder injury. He was replaced by Rob Font in a catchweight bout of 140 pounds. The Ultimate Fighter: Team Joanna vs. Team Cludia women's strawweight winner Tatiana Suarez and Virna Jandiroba were scheduled to meet in a women's strawweight bout. However on June 20, it was announced that Jandiroba pulled out due to a knee injury and was replaced by former UFC Women's Strawweight Champion Jssica Andrade.

programme.title: 2023 Monster Energy British Grand Prix Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights - With more than 60 years of history Silverstone has become one of the most prestigious venues dedicated to motorsport. Completely revamped in recent years, a multimillion pound investment saw the completion in 2010 of a first phase of works to greatly improve the venue, making it one of the fastest tracks on the MotoGP calendar and earning high praise from the World Championship riders who enjoyed the new layout. The Silverstone Wing, a state-of-the-art, multi-million pound complex, became a new landmark at the circuit from 2011, thus adding to already breathtaking facilities at Silverstone
